Author: Sey, Collins; Lei, Hang; Qian, Weizhong; Li, Xiaoyu; Fiasam, Linda Delali; Kodjiku, Seth Larweh; Adjei-Mensah, Isaac; Agyemang, Isaac Osei
Title: VBlock: A blockchain-based tamper-proofing data protection model for internet of vehicle networks
Abstract Note: The rapid advancement of the Internet of Vehicles (IoV) has led to a massive growth in data received from IoV networks. The cloud storage has been a timely service that provides a vast range of data storage for IoV networks. However, existing data storage and access models used to manage and protect data in IoV networks have proven to be insufficient. They are centralized and usually accompanied by a lack of trust, transparency, security, immutability, and provenance. In this paper, we propose VBlock, a blockchain-based system that addresses the issues of illegal modification of outsourced vehicular data for smart city management and improvement. We introduce a novel collusion-resistant model for outsourcing data to cloud storage that ensures the network remains tamper-proof, has good data provenance and auditing, and solves the centralized problems prone to the single point of failure. We introduced a key revocation mechanism to secure the network from malicious nodes. We formally define the system model of VBlock in the setting of a consortium blockchain. Our simulation results and security analysis show that the proposed model provides a strong security guarantee with high efficiency and is practicable in the IoV environment. 【摘要翻译】车辆互联网(IoV)的快速发展导致了从 IoV 网络接收数据的大规模增长。云存储一直是一项及时的服务，为 IoV 网络提供了广泛的数据存储。然而，用于管理和保护 IoV 网络中数据的现有数据存储和访问模型已被证明是不够的。它们是集中的，并且通常伴随着缺乏信任、透明度、安全性、不可变性和来源。在本文中，我们提出了 VBlock，一个基于区块链的系统，解决非法修改外包车辆数据的问题，用于智能城市管理和改进。我们引入了一种新的抗共谋模型来将数据外包到云存储，该模型能够保证网络不被篡改，具有良好的数据来源和审计能力，并且解决了容易发生单点故障的集中问题。我们引入了一种密钥撤销机制来保护网络免受恶意节点的攻击。在联盟区块链的设置下，形式化地定义了 VBlock 的系统模型。仿真结果和安全性分析表明，该模型提供了高效的安全保证，在 IoV 环境下是可行的。
Short Title: 基于区块链的车载网络互联网防篡改数据保护模型

Author: Liu, Xiangguo; Luo, Baiting; Abdo, Ahmed; Abu-Ghazaleh, Nael; Zhu, Qi
Title: Securing connected vehicle applications with an efficient dual cyber- physical blockchain framework
Abstract Note: While connected vehicle (CV) applications have the potential to revolutionize traditional transportation system, cyber and physical attacks on them may lead to disastrous consequences. In this work, we propose an efficient dual cyber-physical blockchain framework to build trust and secure communication for CV applications. Our approach incorporates blockchain technology and physical sensing capabilities of vehicles to quickly react to attacks in a large-scale vehicular network, with low resource overhead. We explore the application of our framework to three CV applications, i.e., highway merging, intelligent intersection management, and traffic network with route choices. Simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of our blockchain-based framework in defending against spoofing attacks, bad mouthing attacks, and Sybil and voting attacks. We also provide analysis to show the timing and resource efficiency of our framework. 【摘要翻译】虽然连接车辆(CV)应用有可能彻底改变传统的交通系统，网络和物理攻击可能会导致灾难性的后果。在这项工作中，我们提出了一个有效的双网络-物理区块链框架，以建立信任和安全通信的简历应用。我们的方法结合了区块链技术和车辆的物理感应能力，以快速反应的攻击，在大规模的车辆网络，以低资源开销。我们探讨了我们的框架在三个 CV 应用中的应用，即高速公路合并、智能交叉口管理和带有路径选择的交通网络。仿真结果表明了我们的区块链框架在防御欺骗性攻击、恶意口供攻击、 Sybil 攻击和投票攻击方面的有效性。我们还提供了分析，以显示我们的框架的时机和资源效率。
Short Title: 通过有效的双网络-物理区块链框架保护连接的车辆应用程序

Author: Sedar, Roshan; Kalalas, Charalampos; Alonso-Zarate, Jesus; Vazquez-Gallego, Francisco
Title: Multi-domain denial-of-service attacks in internet-of-vehicles: Vulnerability insights and detection performance
Publication Title: 2022 IEEE 8th International Conference on Network Softwarization (NetSoft)
Abstract Note: The transformative Internet-of-Vehicles (IoV) paradigm comes inadvertently with challenges which involve security vulnerabilities and privacy breaches. In this context, denial-of-service (DoS) attacks may perniciously affect the normal operation of IoV systems by causing extensive periods of network unavailability where legitimate vehicles are prevented from accessing vehicular services. In this paper, we offer an in-depth vulnerability assessment of 5G-enabled IoV systems when DoS attack variants are launched at multiple network domains. We further evaluate the resilience of an IoV-tailored authentication mechanism against DoS attacks under various configurations. A data-driven detection scheme is also proposed to address DoS variants in the radio access network, which take the form of false data injection attacks on the exchanged vehicular information. Our performance assessment with the aid of an open-source dataset reveals that the proposed scheme is able to accurately detect DoS traffic originated from malicious vehicles. 【摘要翻译】变革性的车辆互联网(IoV)范式无意中带来了涉及安全漏洞和隐私破坏的挑战。在这种情况下，拒绝服务(DoS)攻击可能会对 IoV 系统的正常运行造成有害影响，因为它会导致合法车辆无法访问车辆服务的长时间网络不可用。在本文中，我们提供了一个深入的脆弱性评估5G 支持的 IoV 系统时，DoS 攻击变种发射在多个网络域。我们进一步评估了 IoV 定制的认证机制在不同配置下对 DoS 攻击的弹性。提出了一种基于数据驱动的检测方案来解决无线接入网中的拒绝服务攻击(DoS)问题，该方案采用对交换的车辆信息进行虚假数据注入攻击的形式。我们借助于一个开源数据集进行的性能评估表明，该方案能够准确地检测来自恶意车辆的 DoS 流量。
Short Title: 车辆互联网中的多域拒绝服务攻击: 漏洞洞察和检测性能
Publisher: IEEE / IEEE; Intel; Huawei; Eolo; Italtel; Tiesse

Author: Panda, Sakshyam; Rass, Stefan; Moschoyiannis, Sotiris; Liang, K.; Loukas, George; Panaousis, Emmanouil
Title: HoneyCar: A framework to configure honeypot vulnerabilities on the internet of vehicles
Abstract Note: The Internet of Vehicles (IoV), whereby interconnected vehicles that communicate with each other and with road infrastructure on a common network, has promising socio-economic benefits but also poses new cyber-physical threats. To protect these entities and learn about adversaries, data on attackers can be realistically gathered using decoy systems like honeypots. Admittedly, honeypots introduces a trade-off between the level of honeypot-attacker interactions and incurred overheads and costs for implementing and monitoring these systems. Deception through honeypots can be achieved by strategically configuring the honeypots to represent components of the IoV to engage attackers and collect cyber threat intelligence. Here, we present HoneyCar, a novel decision support framework for honeypot deception in IoV. HoneyCar benefits from the repository of known vulnerabilities of the autonomous and connected vehicles found in the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposure (CVE) database to compute optimal honeypot configuration strategies. The adversarial interaction is modelled as a repeated imperfect-information zero-sum game where the IoV network administrator strategically chooses a set of vulnerabilities to offer in a honeypot and a strategic attacker chooses a vulnerability to exploit under uncertainty. Our investigation examines two different versions of the game, with and without the re-configuration cost, to empower the network administrator to determine optimal honeypot investment strategies given a budget. We show the feasibility of this approach in a case study that consists of the vulnerabilities in autonomous and connected vehicles gathered from the CVE database and data extracted from the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS). 【摘要翻译】车辆互联网(IoV)是指互相连接的车辆在一个共同的网络上相互通信，并与道路基础设施进行通信。它具有良好的社会经济效益，但也带来了新的网络物理威胁。为了保护这些实体并了解对手，可以使用诱饵系统(如蜜罐)实际收集攻击者的数据。诚然，蜜罐引入了蜜罐-攻击者交互级别与实现和监视这些系统的开销和成本之间的权衡。通过蜜罐进行欺骗可以通过战略性地配置蜜罐来代表 IOV 的组成部分，从而使攻击者受到攻击并收集网络威胁情报来实现。在这里，我们介绍了 HoneyCar，一个新的用于 IoV 中蜜罐欺骗的决策支持框架。HoneyCar 从公共漏洞和暴露(CVE)数据库中发现的自主和连接车辆的已知漏洞存储库中获益，以计算最佳蜜罐配置策略。这种对抗性的互动被建模为一种重复的不完美信息零和游戏，在这种游戏中，IoV 网络管理员战略性地选择一组漏洞在蜜罐中提供，而战略性的攻击者则选择一个漏洞在不确定性下利用。我们的调查研究了两种不同版本的游戏，有和没有重新配置成本，以授权网络管理员决定最佳蜜罐投资策略给定的预算。通过一个案例研究，我们证明了该方法的可行性，该案例研究包括从 CVE 数据库中收集的自主和连接车辆的脆弱性以及从通用脆弱性评分系统(CVSS)中提取的数据。
Short Title: HoneyCar: 一个在车辆互联网上配置蜜罐漏洞的框架

Author: Ma, Tianye; Zhang, Rui; Nejad, Mark
Title: Secure connected vehicle-based traffic signal systems against data spoofing attacks
Publication Title: 2021 IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference (WCNC)
Abstract Note: The emerging Connected Vehicle (CV) technology is widely expected to greatly enhance traffic safety and efficiency by enabling vehicles, pedestrians, and infrastructures to communicate with one another. As a promising CV application, CV-based traffic signal control aims to improve the traffic efficiency at intersections by dynamically optimizing traffic signal control plans based on the mobility information submitted by surrounding CVs. Effective CV-based traffic control relies on accurate estimation of the queue length i.e., the number of vehicles waiting at intersections, to determine the optimal traffic signal control plans. Despite significant efforts on accurate queue length estimation, the robustness of queue length estimation has so far received very limited attention. A recent study has demonstrated that it is possible for malicious CVs to significantly manipulate the queue length estimation by reporting false mobility data, which can cause severe traffic congestion. To tackle this challenge, we introduce a robust queue length estimation mechanism that first utilizes the mobility data reported by all the CVs waiting in the queue to calculate multiple preliminary queue length estimates. Then, the robust statistical methods are adopted to derive a resulting estimated queue length whose accuracy is kept at an acceptable level even though there exist multiple malicious CVs in the queue. The simulation results confirm the effectiveness of the proposed mechanism. 【摘要翻译】人们普遍认为，新兴的连通车辆(CV)技术可以使车辆、行人和基础设施之间相互通信，从而大大提高交通安全和效率。基于 CV 的交通信号控制是一种很有前途的交通信号控制方法，其目的是根据周围 CV 提供的机动性信息，动态优化交叉口的交通信号控制方案，从而提高交叉口的交通效率。有效的基于 CV 的交通控制依赖于准确估计排队长度，即在交叉口等待的车辆数，以确定最优的交通信号控制方案。尽管人们在准确估计队列长度方面付出了巨大的努力，但是队列长度估计的稳健性迄今为止受到的关注非常有限。最近的一项研究表明，恶意简历有可能通过报告错误的流动性数据来显著操纵队列长度估计，这可能导致严重的交通堵塞。为了解决这一问题，我们引入了一种鲁棒的队列长度估计机制，该机制首先利用队列中等待的所有简历报告的流动性数据来计算多个初步的队列长度估计。然后，采用稳健统计方法得到队列长度估计值，即使队列中存在多个恶意简历，估计值的准确性也保持在可接受的水平。仿真结果证实了该机构的有效性。

Author: Zhang, Yanghui; Gao, Kai; Huang, Shuo; Li, Xunhao; Du, Ronghua
Title: Forgery trajectory injection attack detection for traffic lights under connected vehicle environment
Publication Title: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Trust, Security and Privacy in Computing and Communications (TrustCom)
Abstract Note: With the connected vehicle (CV) can interact with the infrastructure and can be used as a moving sensor to bring more real-time and higher precision input for intersection signal control. However, such connectivity also brings network security risks.To protect the signal security of intersections, this paper designs a realistic signal attack model based on forged trajectory injection to simulate the potential attack that a smart attacker may launch, the key track points of queued vehicles were extracted, the traffic wave velocity of queued vehicles was used as the distance index to transform forged track recognition into an outlier detection problem, and a forged track detection algorithm based on hierarchical clustering was proposed. Experimental results show that under different attack targets and permeability, the highest detection rate is 95%, and the lowest is 67%. This method does not require training, learning and high computation power of edge equipment. Therefore, it has a certain potential for intersection signal timing using CV trajectory. 【摘要翻译】连通车辆(CV)可以与基础设施相互作用，可以作为运动传感器，为交叉口信号控制带来更多的实时性和更高的输入精度。为了保护交叉口的信号安全，设计了一种基于伪造轨迹注入的真实信号攻击模型，模拟智能攻击者可能发动的攻击，提取排队车辆的关键轨迹点，以排队车辆的交通波速作为距离指标，将伪造轨迹识别转化为一个异常检测问题，提出了一种基于层次聚类的伪造轨迹检测算法。实验结果表明，在不同的攻击目标和渗透率下，最高检测率可达95% ，最低检测率可达67% 。该方法不需要边缘设备的训练、学习和高计算能力。因此，利用 CV 轨迹进行交叉口信号配时具有一定的潜力。

Author: Twardokus, Geoff; Ponicki, Jaime; Baker, Samantha; Carenzo, Peter; Rahbari, Hanif; Mishra, Sumita
Title: Targeted discreditation attack against trust management in connected vehicles
Publication Title: ICC 2021 - IEEE International Conference on Communications
Abstract Note: Vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) communication systems in the U.S. rely on IEEE 1609.2 security protocols for message authentication using digital signatures. A key requirement for trust management in such systems is the ability to detect misbehaving vehicles, e.g., when vehicles are repeatedly forging signatures. However, this creates a new attack surface where receivers cannot determine whether the causes of signature verification failures are indeed malicious attacks. In this paper, we present our novel, open-source, USRP-based testbed and utilize it to demonstrate how a stealthy reactive jammer can exploit this vulnerability. Our novel, targeted attack is highly efficient (even given the short validity period for vehicle pseudonyms) and difficult to detect. Our experimental results show that our attack can successfully discredit a victim in prominent misbehavior detection schemes with just two minutes of jamming. Finally, we discuss the capabilities and extensibility of our testbed as well as the challenges of potential attack mitigation techniques. 【摘要翻译】美国的车辆对车辆(V2V)通信系统依赖于 IEEE 1609.2安全协议来使用数字签名进行消息认证。在这类系统中，信任管理的一个关键要求是能够检测行为不端的车辆，例如，当车辆反复伪造签名时。但是，这将创建一个新的攻击面，其中接收方无法确定导致签名验证失败的原因是否确实是恶意攻击。在本文中，我们提出了一个新颖的、开源的、基于 USRP 的试验平台，并利用它来演示一个隐形的反应式干扰机如何能够利用这一漏洞。我们的新颖的，有针对性的攻击是非常有效的(即使给定的有效期很短的车辆假名)和难以检测。我们的实验结果表明，我们的攻击可以成功地在突出的不良行为检测方案的受害者只需两分钟的干扰。最后，我们讨论了我们的测试平台的功能和可扩展性，以及潜在的攻击缓解技术的挑战。

Author: Zhao, Ning; Zhao, Xudong; Chen, Meng; Zong, Guangdeng; Zhang, Huiyan
Title: Resilient distributed event-triggered platooning control of connected vehicles under denial-of-service attacks
Publication Title: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
Abstract Note: The security control of a vehicle platoon depends on the network topology and communication quality. Denial of service (DoS) attacks force vehicle formations to destabilize by disrupting digital communications between vehicles. To this end, this paper develops a resilient distributed event-triggered security control strategy to resist the malicious impact of DoS attacks on connected vehicles. By designing a distributed event-triggered mechanism based on sampled data, the controller updating frequency is reduced, thereby promoting utilization rate of network resources. Since the end of the attack is not the sampling instant, this may prolong the duration of the attack. To overcome this problem, a switched sampled-data scheme is proposed to ensure that the control signal acts on the system immediately when the attack ends. Then, a switched system model with artificial delay is established to capture the sampling period, event triggering mechanism and DoS attack purpose. With the analysis methods of switched system and time-delay system, sufficient conditions are obtained to guarantee the same safe distance and speed between vehicles, so that the connected vehicle system can achieve the desired tracking effect. A co-design approach is given with respect to controller gains and triggering parameter. Finally, simulation and experimental studies are provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed security control method. 【摘要翻译】车辆排的安全控制取决于网络拓扑和通讯质量。分布式拒绝服务攻击(DoS)攻击通过破坏车辆之间的数字通信，迫使车辆编队失去稳定。为此，本文提出了一种弹性分布式事件触发安全控制策略，以抵御 DoS 攻击对连通车辆的恶意影响。通过设计一种基于采样数据的分布式事件触发机制，降低了控制器的更新频率，从而提高了网络资源的利用率。由于攻击的结束不是采样瞬间，这可能会延长攻击的持续时间。为了克服这一问题，提出了一种切换采样数据方案，以确保控制信号在攻击结束时立即作用于系统。然后，建立了一个具有人工延迟的切换系统模型来捕获采样周期、事件触发机制和 DoS 攻击目的。利用切换系统和时滞系统的分析方法，得到了保证车辆之间安全距离和速度相同的充分条件，使连通车辆系统能够达到预期的跟踪效果。给出了控制器增益和触发参数的协同设计方法。最后，通过仿真和实验验证了该方法的有效性。
Short Title: 拒绝服务攻击下连通车辆弹性分布式事件触发排队控制

Author: Liu, Runzhe; Peng, Xin; Sun, Zhanbo; Huang, Zhihang; Hu, Haitao
Title: Research on cyberattack detection of connected automated vehicles based on support vector machine
Publication Title: 2022 IEEE 7th International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Engineering (ICITE)
Abstract Note: Connected automated vehicles (CAVs) are facing the threat of cyberattacks while exchanging state information. Most of the existing research focuses on the communication technologies and the network security technologies, with the purpose of providing corresponding preventive solutions for the specific technical means of attack behavior, which are highly targeted but weak in universality of application. In this paper, a type of adversary model based on attack effects, namely, disturbance attack, was established. A numerical simulation platform for CAVs cyberattack experiment was built to quantitatively analyze the impacts of CAVs cyberattacks on traffic. 9 measurement indicators were constructed based on traffic safety indicators and traffic flow parameters for the characteristic impacts of various attacks. Using the cyberattack experiment simulation platform to generate attack feature datasets, A cyberattack detection model of CAVs on the basis of nonlinear Support Vector Machine was established. The model showed a sound classification performance, with a detection rate of more than 95% within 3s of the attack. The research method in this paper has a universal reference value for cyberattacks detection of CAVs. The results help better understand the effects of CAV-related cyberattacks and shed light on proactive defense against such attacks. 【摘要翻译】互联自动化车辆(CAV)在交换状态信息的同时也面临着网络攻击的威胁。现有的研究大多集中在通信技术和网络安全技术方面，目的是针对攻击行为的具体技术手段提供相应的预防解决方案。本文建立了一种基于攻击效应的攻击模型，即干扰攻击模型。为了定量分析 CAV 网络攻击对交通的影响，建立了 CAV 网络攻击实验数值模拟平台。基于交通安全指标和交通流量参数构建了9个衡量指标，分析了各种攻击的特征影响。利用网络攻击实验仿真平台生成攻击特征数据集，建立了基于非线性支持向量机的 CAV 网络攻击检测模型。该模型具有良好的分类性能，在攻击发生后3s 内检测率达到95% 以上。本文的研究方法对于 CAV 网络攻击检测具有普遍的参考价值。研究结果有助于更好地理解与 CAV 相关的网络攻击的影响，并为主动防御此类攻击提供了依据。
Short Title: 基于支持向量机的互联自动化车辆网络攻击检测研究

Author: Pethő, Zsombor; Szalay, Zsolt; Török, Árpád
Title: Safety risk focused analysis of V2V communication especially considering cyberattack sensitive network performance and vehicle dynamics factors
Abstract Note: Future transportation is expected to be connected, cooperative, and highly automated. Classic automated vehicular functions are developed based on safety principles primarily, but the reliability and cybersecu-rity of wireless communication processes pose new challenges for the automotive industry for connected vehicles, representing Connected, Cooperative and Automated Mobility (CCAM) systems as cyber-physical systems. Since CCAM system safety is significantly affected by network performance metrics, we need to consider communication factors such as end-to-end latency and packet delivery ratio during the safety evaluation of highly automated vehicle functions. This study presents a methodological framework which links the safety of the CCAM systems with the cyber security sensitive network performance metrics, as well as the vehicle dynamics factors in order to evaluate the effect of intentional or unintentional communication failures. Accordingly, we introduced a new approach to characterize the safety risk of specific Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) applications. Beyond this, severity of collision and message reception probability functions were introduced to further investigate the safety of the analyzed application. Finally, the values of the safety risk index for different warning intervals are summed, which suggest that the safety effect of specific function-related parameters could be and shall be represented during the function development process.(c) 2022 The Author(s). Published by Elsevier Inc. This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/). 【摘要翻译】未来的交通运输预计将是连接、合作和高度自动化的。传统的汽车自动化功能主要是在安全原则的基础上发展起来的，但是无线通信过程的可靠性和网络安全性对汽车行业的连通车辆提出了新的挑战，这些连通车辆代表了连通、协同和自动移动(CCAM)系统作为网络物理系统。由于 CCAM 系统的安全性受到网络性能指标的显著影响，在高度自动化车辆功能的安全性评估中，需要考虑端到端延迟和分组传输率等通信因素。这项研究提出了一个方法框架，将网络安全敏感网络性能指标与 CCAM 系统的安全性以及车辆动力学因素联系起来，以评估故意或非故意通信故障的影响。因此，我们引入了一种新的方法来表征特定的车辆对车辆(V2V)应用的安全风险。除此之外，引入了冲突严重性和消息接收概率函数，以进一步研究分析应用程序的安全性。最后，总结了不同预警间隔时间的安全风险指数值，表明功能相关参数的安全效应可以在功能开发过程中得到体现。(c)2022作者。由爱思唯尔公司出版。这是 CC BY-NC-nd 许可证下的一篇开放存取文章( http://creativecommons.org/licenses/BY-NC-ND/4.0/)。
Short Title: 针对 V2V 通讯的安全风险分析，特别考虑到网络攻击敏感的网络性能和车辆动力学因素
Extra: 🏷️ /Done、📒、安全风险、车辆动力学、网络安全、系统安全、notion、📝 创新

Author: Liu, Jingwei; Li, Yating; Sun, Rong; Liu, Lei; Zhang, Ning; Yu, F. Richard; Leung, Victor C. M.
Title: SDSS: Secure data sharing scheme for edge enabled IoV networks
Publication Title: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
Abstract Note: With the large-scale deployment of the Internet of Vehicles (IoV) and 5G technologies, it is inevitable to share data frequently for superior in-vehicle services. However, due to the dynamically changing and widely distributed Vehicular Ad-hoc Networks (VANETs), data sharing still faces challenges in security, efficiency, and reliability. In this paper, we propose a secure and reliable data-sharing scheme (SDSS) for edge-enabled IoV networks. It assigns multiple attribute authorities to alleviate the management burden and support a large attribute universe catering to the various services in IoV. To enhance efficiency and flexibility, edge computing is introduced for quickly responding to vehicles’ requests and assisting resource-constrained vehicle computation. And an online/offline mechanism is designed to further alleviate the computational pressure of sharing data online. In addition, we put forward a cooperative key generation approach to guarantee the security of users’ private keys. The security analysis proves that SDSS ensures resistance to collusion attacks and indistinguishability under chosen-ciphertext attacks (IND-CCA). Moreover, it can avoid the single point of failure and resist denial of service (DoS) attacks with the help of multiple distributed edge nodes. The experiment demonstrates SDSS is practicable for IoV data sharing. 【摘要翻译】随着车辆互联网(IoV)和5G 技术的大规模应用，车载服务的高质量不可避免地需要频繁地共享数据。然而，由于动态变化和分布广泛的车辆自组织网络(VANET) ，数据共享仍然面临着安全性、高效性和可靠性方面的挑战。本文提出了一种基于边缘支持的 IoV 网络安全可靠的数据共享方案(SDSS)。它分配了多个属性权限来减轻管理负担，并支持一个大属性宇宙来满足 IoV 中各种服务的需求。为了提高效率和灵活性，引入了边缘计算，以快速响应车辆的请求，并辅助资源受限的车辆计算。设计了一种在线/离线机制，进一步减轻了在线共享数据的计算压力。此外，我们还提出了一种协同密钥生成方法来保证用户私钥的安全性。安全性分析表明，SDSS 在选择密文攻击(IND-CCA)下能够保证抗合谋攻击和不可区分性。此外，多个分布式边缘节点可以避免单点故障，抵御分布式拒绝服务攻击攻击。实验表明，SDSS 对 IoV 数据共享是可行的。
Short Title: 支持边缘的 IoV 网络安全数据共享方案
Extra: 🏷️ /Done、📒、边缘协同计算、车联网、低时延、访问控制、共谋攻击、数据共享、细粒度数据访问、线性秘密共享、选择密文攻击、notion
